events.long_description: Team up with 5 other friends to compete to be the best in your region. This event will occur over 3 days, with 3 different rounds. The first day will be completely open, and teams can play up to 15 matches. The top 128 scores will advance to the next day. events.short_description: Each day is a separate tournament!
events.long_description: The Fortnite Celebration Cup Solo competition will take place on Saturday, February 15 and Sunday, February 16. Players will have an opportunity to earn in-game items like the Tango Outfit, Wild Accent pickaxe, and the Take Cover spray on February 15. Then progress resets, and players will have the opportunity to earn a share of the $1,000,000 prize pool on February 16! Both days are open to all eligible PlayStation 4 Fortnite players. 2FA and account level 15+ required. For complete details, check out our Official Rules at https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/competitive/rules-library

events.short_description: DreamHack Anaheim Open BYOC
events.long_description:
February 21 - 23. This is a tournament for festival visitors only and will not be broadcasted. For assistance and contact with the tournament admins, please use this discord link: discord.gg/dreamhack. You can also check out the event rules here: https://dreamhack.com/anaheim/fortnite/ Best of luck!

The biggest BYOC Fortnite tournament ever held in the United States! This community focused tournament features a whopping $250,000 prize pool up for grabs. Best of luck!

events.short_description: Compete for an opportunity to win the new Tart Tycoon Outfit, gaming hardware, and exclusive apparel!
events.long_description: These are the last days of the entire Fortnite community being able to cross-play with each other until victory. Apple has blocked Fortnite from the App Store, so not all iPhone and iPad players will be able to play together after the Chapter 2 - Season 4 launch on August 27. Top scoring players across all regions will receive the delicious Tart Tycoon Outfit. The very top scoring players across all regions will receive a #FreeFortnite adjustable hat. Additionally, be one of the top apple-eaters in a single game or one of the top apple-eaters across the whole tournament in your region for an opportunity to win even more prizes! Full details and official rules at fn.gg/FreeFortniteCup. PLEASE NOTE: The Victory Royale scoring text below is slightly bugged. Victory Royales are worth 10 points, and every 3 minutes spent in a match is worth 1 point.

events.short_description: Grab your trio and warm up for the upcoming Fortnite Champion Series!

This tournament occurs across three rounds - Round One (Opens), Round Two (Top 1000 trios EU/NAE, Top 700 trios NAW/BR, Top 350 trios ASIA/OCE/ME) and Round Three (Top 33 trios per region). Round Three adds scores from each session across two days. This event is a practice tournament and has no cash prizes.

events.short_description: Compete in the Fortnite Champion Series: Chapter 3 - Season 2 for a share of the $3,000,000 total prize pool.
events.long_description: Reach Champion League in Arena mode to unlock this event. This Qualifier occurs across four rounds - Round One (Champion Ranked Duos), Round Two (Top 2000 duos EU/NA/BR, Top 1000 duos ASIA/ME, Top 500 duos OCE), Round Three (Top 500 duos EU/NA/BR, Top 250 duos ASIA/ME/OCE), and Round Four (Top 50 duos). The top 5 teams at the conclusion of Round Four in each region will skip Semi-Finals and advance directly to the Finals. Teams will also accumulate Series Points based on each Qualifier's results, and top performers will be invited to the Semi-Finals. Full rules and details can be found at fortnite.com/competitive

events.short_description: Compete in the Fortnite Champion Series: Chapter 3 - Season 2 for a share of the $3,000,000 total prize pool.
events.long_description: Aim to be a top ranked duo on the Series Leaderboard to be invited to these Semi-Finals. Each duo will be assigned to a starting Session based on their final Series Points Leaderboard ranking. Win a match in your Session or be a top ranked team at the end of the Session to advance to the Finals. Those who don't advance at the end of Session 1 will have another chance in Session 2. Those who don't advance at the end of Session 2 will have another chance in Session 3. Full rules and details can be found at fortnite.com/competitive

events.short_description: Compete in the Fortnite Champion Series: Chapter 3 - Season 2 for a share of the $3,000,000 total prize pool.
events.long_description: Advance from the Semi-Finals or a Qualifier to be invited to the FNCS Finals and compete in the season's pinnacle of Fortnite competition! The Finals adds scores from each session across two days of play, but can end early if Match Point is reached by any duo team (3 Victory Royales + 475 points). Full rules and details can be found at fortnite.com/competitive
